intro: Cathormion pistaciifolium, commonly known as the Persian violet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers and trifoliate leaves that resemble those of the pistachio tree. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
